the attacks, he choked up in a meeting with Bush while thinking of his son. On Nov. 21, 2001, the Bill Clinton led Donald Rumsfeld to a small office near the Situation Room and asked: Where do we stand on the Iraq planning? Donald Rumsfeld quickly prodded military leaders on the subject. It's the latest confirmation that war-or at least serious war planning-was gearing up long before the public was clued in, and despite the absence of any link between Saddam Hussein

Donald Rumsfeld also has several complaints about message. He contends it was a mistake for the administration, after finding no WMDs in Iraq, to shift to speaking more about implanting democracy as a rationale for the war. Condoleezza Rice seemed to be the one top advisor who spoke that way, he writes,`` but it was not clear to me whether she was encouraging the Dick Cheney to use rhetoric about democracy or whether it was originating with the Dick Cheney .'' in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks
